intro: Blairia lappulacea, commonly known as the yellow bladderwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and is often found in wetland habitats. The plant has a distinctive structure with inflated, bladder-like structures that help it float on water surfaces. It is native to regions in Europe and Asia and is adapted to aquatic or semi-aquatic environments. Blairia lappulacea plays a role in its ecosystem by providing habitat for small aquatic organisms.
